author: Sean Murphy

review: What you don't find out until probably after you've purchased this thing (taking the adverts at their word) is that the standard routers provided by the major broadband providers CenturyLink and Comcast are NOT compatible with Chromecast.  You will have to go buy a router of your own and set it up if you want it to work consistently and you want Google to fully support it.  After many hours on the phone with Google, Netflix, CenturyLink and ActionTec to try to figure out why the Chromecast kept getting dropped by my router, a Google tech finally pointed me to their "compatibility" page and I found out the router I was renting from CenturyLink (along with untold millions of other people) was not compatible with the Google device.  I am just in shock that a company like Google can advertise this as the ultimate Plug N Play media streamer, knowing that is far from the truth for a substantial number of people out there.  My glee over dumping the conmen of cable for the brave new world of streaming media has been pretty thoroughly extinguished.
author: Chris H.

review: With over 7K five star reviews for the Chromecast, I don't have much to add about how this device works. I bought my first Chromecast for my parents so they could keep up with programs that they lost when they switched from satellite tv to regular cable. I didn't know what to expect from the Chromecast but I figured at 35 dollars it didn't hurt to try it, and it could always be returned if it was a dud. As it turned out the Chromecast is the perfect solution for anyone switching from satellite or cable to internet TV. I liked it so much I bought a second one for myself just a few days later.This gizmo has worked with everything I've thrown at it. I have high speed cable internet which is fast 95% of the time so my tv images are beautiful and issues with lag or buffering using Chromecast have been minimal. Note however that Chromecast may not work as well with slower internet speeds. In short, if you're wondering which streaming device to get and you have fast internet - pick the Chromecast!
